title:
English version of "Screen-line counter location problem with O/D cut
  selection approach"
abstract:
This paper provides an efficient solution approach to the screen-line counter
location problem (SCLP), which is a counter location problem with the
constraint that the traffic between OD pairs must be observed at least once.
This paper formulates the SCLP using a graph cut approach, which consists of an
enumeration of cuts and a cut selection problem. These problems can be reduced
to a concise formulation that extends the maximum weight closure problem for
two problems: finding the minimum number of links that observe all OD pairs and
finding the maximum number of observed OD pairs with a budget-constrained
number of links. Insights into the characteristics of cuts give superior upper
bounds on the problem of finding the minimum number of links that observe all
OD pairs. The proposed method is evaluated on the Sioux-Falls network. It shows
that it is possible to derive a solution equivalent to the optimal solution
found in previous studies in a very short computation time.
